post_text:
Kindergarten Registration Update (7/2/20):

We wanted to share the proposed Kindergarten process for this school year. Please keep in mind this is subject to change as we rely on guidance from the state to determine what safety measures need to be put in place within our schools. We will communicate any necessary changes to this plan if a need to do so arises.

Screenings: Thursday, September 3rd
Finalizing Placement: Friday, September 4th
Kindergarten Open House: Tuesday, September 8th
1st Day of Kindergarten: Wednesday, September 9th

If you have not already done so, you can mail completed registration paperwork and required corresponding documents to the school or scan and email them to ekenney@slrsd.org.

The registration packet can be accessed electronically or you may call the office @ (781)293-2581 to request a packet be mailed to your home. Please reach out to us if you have any further questions.

post_text:
Dear Community,

Out of an abundance of caution and as an additional preventative measure, our schools in Silver Lake, Halifax, Kingston, and Plympton are cancelled for Friday, March 13, 2020. This will allow the district to spend three days to clean all of our facilities and will provide us with more time to process information that may be forthcoming from our state and federal agencies.

All schools will be closed tomorrow and throughout the weekend. All after school activities and evening events are cancelled. We will return to classes on Monday, March 16th.

As more information becomes available, we will continue to communicate our plans.

Thank you,

Dr. Jill A. Proulx
text:
Dear Community,

Out of an abundance of caution and as an additional preventative measure, our schools in Silver Lake, Halifax, Kingston, and Plympton are cancelled for Friday, March 13, 2020. This will allow the district to spend three days to clean all of our facilities and will provide us with more time to process information that may be forthcoming from our state and federal agencies.

All schools will be closed tomorrow and throughout the weekend. All after school activities and evening events are cancelled. We will return to classes on Monday, March 16th.

As more information becomes available, we will continue to communicate our plans.

Thank you,

Dr. Jill A. Proulx

post_text: Congratulations to these 22 sixth graders who spend two weeks after school and on weekends building their own underwater robots from scratch! These were in preparation to compete in the Southern New England SeaPerch Regional competition at Bridgewater State University on March 14 (competition now postponed to a later date). These students learned many building and electrical skills alongside awesome parent volunteers. Great teamwork by all! Thank you to the HES PTO for the funding!

These students learned many building and electrical skills alongside awesome parent volunteers. Great teamwork by all! Thank you to the HES PTO for the funding!

The Scholastic Book Fair will be at Halifax Elementary School during the week of March 16th. Students will have the opportunity to shop during their weekly library class and the book fair will also be open during parent/teacher conferences.

In order for the book fair to be a success, we need your help! Please volunteer by clicking on the link below. All volunteers must have a CORI on file with the main office.

If you have any questions, please email Ms. Thibeault at jthibeault@slrsd.org

Thank you!

post_text:
Silver Lake Integrated Preschool Program

Open House and Peer Model Screening

*Now Accepting Applications*

The SLIP is accepting applications for 3 and 4 year old peer model students for the 2020-2021 school year. There will be an Open House and Screening for peer models and applications are available at the Integrated Preschool main entrance located at 150 Main Street, Kingston. They are also available at the Halifax, Kingston, and Plympton Elementary Schools.

What: Integrated Preschool Open House and Screening for Peer Models Students will participate in a classroom activity while parents meet with staff

Where: Silver Lake Integrated Preschool, 150 Main Street Kingston

When: Wednesday, January 22nd and Wednesday, January 29th

Time: 12:30 p.m.- 1:15 p.m. and 1:30p.m. - 2:15 p.m

R.S.V.P: Kelly Reed @ kreed@slrsd.org @ 781-585-4382 x4001

If you have any questions please don’t hesitate to contact Principal Kerri Whipple @ 781-585-3821 or kerriwhipple@slrsd.org

post_text:
UPDATE: School is CLOSED today.

[SLRSD] Good morning, this is a message from Superintendent Joy Blackwood. With the sun up and the Department of Public Works having evaluated the roads, school is now CLOSED today October 17, 2019 in Halifax, Kingston, Plympton, and Silver Lake. There are downed wires and trees, so please be safe today.
text:
UPDATE: School is CLOSED today.

[SLRSD] Good morning, this is a message from Superintendent Joy Blackwood. With the sun up and the Department of Public Works having evaluated the roads, school is now CLOSED today October 17, 2019 in Halifax, Kingston, Plympton, and Silver Lake. There are downed wires and trees, so please be safe today.

post_text: [SLRSD] Good morning this is Superintendent Joy Blackwood. Due to the recent storm, there will be a **two hour delayed opening** in Halifax, Kingston, Plympton, and Silver Lake Regional Schools this morning October 17, 2019. Please stay safe everyone.
text: [SLRSD] Good morning this is Superintendent Joy Blackwood. Due to the recent storm, there will be a **two hour delayed opening** in Halifax, Kingston, Plympton, and Silver Lake Regional Schools this morning October 17, 2019. Please stay safe everyone.

post_text: The HES community continues to partner with the Helping Hands of Halifax. Throughout the month of October we are encouraging all students and families to donate unopened, non-perishable canned or packaged food items. Students should drop items in the main lobby as they enter the school building. We are also seeking Stop and Shop gift cards to purchase turkeys for the holiday season (average cost for one turkey is around $25). All donation amounts are graciously welcome and should be turned into the main office. The food drive will conclude on Thursday, November 7th.

post_text:
Fall Into Reading Challenge!

Starting Monday, September 23rd, record the number of minutes you read (or someone reads to you) each week. The student from each class with the highest number of minutes read will be invited to a pizza party!

All students who participate will be entered into a drawing!

*Worksheets must be completed and signed in order to participate. Worksheets are due on Wednesday, October 25th. Any questions, please email:

Mrs. Heaney: lheaney@slrsd.org
Mrs. Perkins: alyssaperkins@slrsd.org
Ms. Thibeault: jthibeault@slrsd.org

Family Night
Presented by the
Halifax Teachers Association
Come enjoy a fun night out with your family and
teachers to benefit the Halifax Teachers
Association Scholarship Fund!
Visit our Facebook page for updates: fb.me/halifaxteachersassociation
Who: K-6 students and families
Where: Halifax Elementary School
When: April 26th 5-8pm
Admission: $5 a person or $10 per family. (Admission allows access to
all events.)
Family Night activities include:
● Grade 6 basketball game
● Family Bingo (tons of
prizes!)
● Karaoke
● RAFFLES (more info to
come.)
● Movies and popcorn
● Pizza, snacks and ice cream
sundaes
● Face painting
● 50/50 raffle!!

post_text: This winter, students in Grades 4-6 STEM club participated in PBS' Design Squad Global. As students completed environmentally conscious STEM projects, they were able to connect with partner clubs in Kenya who completed the same projects. Photos and videos were exchanged. Today, students participated in a LIVE video call with the students and teachers.
text: This winter, students in Grades 4-6 STEM club participated in PBS' Design Squad Global. As students completed environmentally conscious STEM projects, they were able to connect with partner clubs in Kenya who completed the same projects. Photos and videos were exchanged. Today, students participated in a LIVE video call with the students and teachers.

post_text: On this Global Day of the Engineer, congratulations to Mrs. Whitney's 6th grade Science class for being one of 12 winners in the 2019 Fluor Engineering Challenge. Flour Corporation awarded them $1000! Working with limited materials and their imaginations, the students used the engineering design process and created a volleyball machine using only cups, tape, wooden pencils, craft sticks and paper. Thank you to Flour Corporation for this exciting opportunity! Sciencebuddies Fluor Corporation
text: On this Global Day of the Engineer, congratulations to Mrs. Whitney's 6th grade Science class for being one of 12 winners in the 2019 Fluor Engineering Challenge. Flour Corporation awarded them $1000! Working with limited materials and their imaginations, the students used the engineering design process and created a volleyball machine using only cups, tape, wooden pencils, craft sticks and paper. Thank you to Flour Corporation for this exciting opportunity! Sciencebuddies Fluor Corporation

text:
Dear HES families,

Volunteers are needed for the Scholastic book fair taking place 3/18-3/22 with a set up day on 3/15. If you can help for a time slot or more it is greatly appreciated. You do need to have a current CORI on file in order to volunteer. If one is needed please see Ellen Kenney at the main office.
https://volunteer.scholastic.com/#/signup/g0us4ybiB
Sincerely,

HES PTO
Sharon Smith ssmith@halifaxpto.org

VOLUNTEER.SCHOLASTIC.COM
Volunteers make a difference.

post_text: Excited to have Jump Man J and T-Rex Trent running our Boosterthon activities this morning. Don't forget to go to funrun.com to help us reach our goal!
text: Excited to have Jump Man J and T-Rex Trent running our Boosterthon activities this morning. Don't forget to go to funrun.com to help us reach our goal!

post_text:
Hi Halifax Families!

Today we kicked off the Boosterthon program here at our school…this is our major fundraiser of the year! The students and staff are very excited to have the Boosterthon team on campus the next two weeks as we learn how to be 21st century heroes though the Mind Spark Mystery Lab and to help our school!

This year, we are raising $30,000 for our school! So, we need your help...

Today, each student will be coming home with a pledge book. This book provides the steps for how to log onto funrun.com and register your student.

Student registration code: 252-811
Be sure to check out the "Student Star Video." This is a fun and easy way to let potential sponsors know that they can support our school - and your child will love being the star in their very own movie!

Thank you for your help!

- Halifax Elementary

post_text: Thank you to Halifax health agent Cathleen Drinan for spending the day with Halifax Elementary 6th graders! She taught them all about where our water comes from, how and why she tests the Monponsett Ponds, and then did a demonstration on how easily our groundwater can get polluted! Great local education! Thank you for sharing your time and expertise!
text: Thank you to Halifax health agent Cathleen Drinan for spending the day with Halifax Elementary 6th graders! She taught them all about where our water comes from, how and why she tests the Monponsett Ponds, and then did a demonstration on how easily our groundwater can get polluted! Great local education! Thank you for sharing your time and expertise!

post_text:
Please be reminded that Spring Portraits are Wednesday, 2/27.

Each classroom is assigned a specific time slot, so we are not able to manage sibling photos due to the conflict it causes with scheduling.

Any specific questions you may have about portraits should be directed to Lifetouch (800)736-4753.
